revision.text:
{{redirect-distinguish|Tardar Sauce|Tartar sauce}} {{short description|Cat and Internet meme celebrity (2012–2019)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2019}} {{Infobox animal | name = Grumpy Cat | image = Grumpy Cat (14556024763) (cropped).jpg | caption = Grumpy Cat at [[VidCon]] 2014 | othername = Tardar Sauce | species = ''[[Cat|Felis catus]]'' | breed = Mixed | gender = Female | birth_date = {{Birth date|2012|4|4|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Morristown, Arizona]] U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|2019|5|14|2012|4|4|mf=yes}} | death_place = Morristown, Arizona, U.S. | years_active = 2012–2019 | known = Being an [[Internet meme]] | awards = | owner = Tabatha Bundesen | namedafter = [[Tartar sauce]] | website = {{URL|http://www.grumpycats.com/}}}} '''Tardar Sauce''' (April 4, 2012<ref name="16facts" /> – May 14, 2019), nicknamed '''Grumpy Cat''', was an American [[Internet celebrity]] cat. She was known for her [[Resting bitch face|permanently "grumpy" facial appearance]], which was caused by an [[Malocclusion|underbite]] and [[dwarf cat|feline dwarfism]].<ref name="16facts" /><ref name="news.com.au">{{cite news |last=Colvin|first=William|url= https://www.news.com.au/technology/internet-finds-worlds-grumpiest-cat-named-tardar-sauce/news-story/d7027c05bf9f296d988a72f4dc8faac5|title=Internet finds world's grumpiest cat, named Tardar Sauce p|website=[[news.com.au]] |date=September 28, 2012 |access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref name="abc">{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/blogs/technology/2013/03/grumpy-cat-the-internets-favorite-sour-cat-draws-crowds-at-sxsw/|title=Grumpy Cat: The Internet's Favorite Sour Cat Draws Crowds at SXSW|last=Stern|first=Joanna|date=March 10, 2013|publisher=ABC News|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> She came to prominence when a photograph of her was posted on September 22, 2012, on social news website [[Reddit]] by Bryan Bundesen, the brother of her owner Tabatha Bundesen.<ref name="16facts">{{cite web|url=http://mentalfloss.com/article/53217/16-fun-facts-about-grumpy-cat|title=16 Fun Facts About Grumpy Cat|last=McCarthy|first=Erin|date=October 16, 2013|website=Mental Floss|access-date=August 3, 2018}}</ref><ref name="cnn">{{cite news|last=Griggs|first=Brandon|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/03/10/tech/web/grumpy-cat-sxsw/index.html|title=The unlikely star of SXSW: Grumpy Cat|date=March 11, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019|publisher=CNN}}</ref> "[[Lolcat]]s" and [[Parody|parodies]] created from the photograph by Reddit users became popular. She was the subject of a popular [[Internet meme]] in which humorously negative, cynical images were made from photographs of her.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/grumpy-cat|title=Grumpy Cat|work=Know Your Meme|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref>
As of August 23, 2020, Grumpy Cat had 8.3 million total likes on [[Facebook]],<ref>{{cite web|title=The Official Grumpy Cat|url=https://m.facebook.com/pg/TheOfficialGrumpyCat/community/?ref=page_internal&mt_nav=0|access-date=28 October 2019|via=Facebook}}</ref> 2.6 million followers on [[Instagram]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Grumpy Cat (@realgrumpycat)|url=https://www.instagram.com/realgrumpycat/|access-date=28 October 2019|via=Instagram}}</ref> 1.5 million followers on [[Twitter]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Grumpy Cat (@RealGrumpyCat)|url=https://twitter.com/RealGrumpyCat|access-date=28 October 2019|via=Twitter}}</ref> and 283,000 subscribers on [[YouTube]].
== Background == Tardar Sauce was one of a litter of four kittens born to a [[Calico cat|calico]] mother and a blue-and-white [[tabby]] putative father at the home of her owner, Tabatha Bundesen of [[Morristown, Arizona]].<ref name="16facts" /> The Bundesens said that Tardar Sauce's face appeared grumpy because the feline had a form of [[Dwarf cat|dwarfism]].<ref name="about" /> Though the mother and father were described as "normal-sized [[Domestic short-haired cat|domestic short-hair cats]]",<ref name="about">{{cite web|url=http://www.grumpycats.com/about|title=About Grumpy Cat|website=grumpycats.com|access-date=July 31, 2018}}</ref> Tardar Sauce was undersized and had hind legs that are "a bit different".<ref name="16facts" /> Both she and her brother, Pokey, were born with "a flat face, bubble eyes, and a short tail".<ref name="news.com.au" /> Although she had a "grumpy" appearance and was called "Grumpy Cat", according to the Bundesens, "Ninety-nine percent of the time she is just a regular cat."<ref name="abc"/>
"Meme manager" Ben Lashes represented Grumpy Cat, in addition to [[Keyboard Cat]] and [[Nyan Cat]].<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Rothman |first=Lily |url=http://entertainment.time.com/2013/04/18/internet-cats-behind-the-memes/ |title='Lil Bub & Friendz': Internet Cats, Behind the Memes |magazine=Time |date=April 18, 2013 |access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> In 2013, Tabatha Bundesen took a [[leave of absence]] from her job at [[Red Lobster]] to manage Grumpy Cat's schedule, while her brother Bryan Bundesen manages the Grumpy Cat website, [[Facebook]], [[YouTube]] and [[Twitter]] accounts.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Jarvey|first=Natalie|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/7-figure-scowl-how-grumpy-721883|title=The 7-Figure Scowl: How Grumpy Cat Is Building a Media Empire|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=July 30, 2014|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref name="wsj">{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424127887324412604578513352795950958|title=Grumpy Cat Has an Agent, and Now a Movie Deal|last=Rosman|first=Katherine|date=May 31, 2013|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|access-date=May 30, 2013|url-access=subscription}}</ref>
==Media appearances== After her debut in 2012, Tardar Sauce made many media appearances, typically accompanied by her owner, Tabatha Bundesen; Tabatha's brother, Bryan Bundesen; and occasionally Tabatha's daughter, Chrystal. Tardar Sauce's handlers were interviewed by the respective hosts of each program. She was also featured in advertising campaigns for [[Friskies]] and [[General Mills|General Mills']] [[Honey Nut Cheerios]], and made public appearances to promote her own brand.
=== 2012 === * [[NBC News]]' ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]'' show<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/video/today/50046072 |title=Meet 'Tardar Sauce,' the grumpy cat gone viral |website=Today.com |date=December 2, 2012 |access-date=June 6, 2013}}</ref>
=== 2013 === * [[ABC News]]' ''[[Good Morning America]]''<ref name="gma" /> * ''[[CBS Evening News]]''<ref>{{Cite web|title=Grumpy Cat, meet Lil Bub; Lil Bub, meet Grumpy Cat|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/video/grumpy-cat-meet-lil-bub-lil-bub-meet-grumpy-cat/|publisher=CBS News|date=November 10, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> * ''[[Anderson Live]]''<ref name="andersonlive" /> * [[VH1]]'s ''[[Big Morning Buzz Live]]''<ref>{{Cite web|title="Big Morning Buzz Live" Steve Carell/Angela 'Big Ang' Raiola/Grumpy Cat (TV Episode 2013)|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2767824/fullcredits|publisher=IMDb|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref> * [[E!|E! Network]]'s ''[[The Soup]]''<ref>{{Cite web|publisher=hghostify|title=Tardar Sauce the Grumpy Cat|date=November 1, 2012|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sXkZje-dSnE|via=YouTube|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref> * [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]]'s ''[[American Idol]]''<ref>{{Cite web|work=American Idol|title=Top 6 – Look! It's Grumpy Cat! – American Idol XIII|date=April 24, 2014|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f1bXhHv5T4s|via=YouTube|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref> * Promoting ''Grumpy Cat: A Grumpy Book'' at [[BookExpo America]]<ref>{{Cite tweet|user=BookExpoAmerica|number=335060249897758720|title=Meet Grumpy Cat, author of GRUMPY CAT: A GRUMPY BOOK, on 5/31 at 3PM at the @ChronicleBooks Booth #739 for photos!|date=May 16, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> * Book launches at [[Los Angeles]] department store, [[Kitson (store)|Kitson]], and [[The Grove at Farmers Market|The Grove]]'s [[Barnes & Noble]]<ref>{{cite news|last=Kellogg |first=Carolyn |url=https://www.latimes.com/features/books/jacketcopy/la-et-jc-grumpy-cat-pawtographs-exclusive-book-preview-20130719,0,3118147.story |title=Grumpy Cat to give 'pawtographs' in L.A.: Exclusive book preview |work=Los Angeles Times |date=July 22, 2013 |access-date=July 29, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2013/07/25/grumpy-cat-book-signing_n_3652485.html |title=Grumpy Cat Does Not Look Impressed At Book Signing In Los Angeles (PICTURES) |work=HuffPost |date=July 25, 2013 |access-date=July 29, 2013}}</ref> *[[Michael Noer (editor)|Michael Noer]] "interviewed" Grumpy Cat for ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine, released March 25, 2013. Seated opposite each other in red velvet accent chairs, Noer satirically supposes that Grumpy Cat's performances have "deeper philosophical underpinnings", "[[Existentialism|existential angst]]", and "[[nihilism]]", then goes on to quote [[Franz Kafka|Kafka]], to which Grumpy Cat "replies" via a popular [[image macro]] with [[Impact (typeface)|Impact typeface]], "I read Kafka once. Wish I hadn't."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/video/2589816701001/|title=Grumpy Cat: The Forbes Interview|last=Noer|first=Michael|date=August 6, 2013|work=Forbes|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
==== South by Southwest ==== [[File:Grumpy Cat SXSW 2013 cropped.jpg|thumb|124px|Grumpy Cat at SXSW 2013]] In March 2013, Tardar Sauce attended [[South by Southwest]] (SXSW) [[SXSW Interactive|Interactive]], hosted at the [[Mashable]] House,<ref name="abc" /><ref name="cnn" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://mashable.com/2013/03/08/sxsw-i-day-1/|title=SXSWi Day 1: Grumpy Cat, 3D Printing and Other Highlights|first=Dani|last=Fankhauser|date=March 9, 2013|publisher=Mashable|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> where she appeared for two-hours each day as Grumpy Cat.<ref name="thewrap">{{cite web|last=Morrison|first=Sara|url=https://www.thewrap.com/movies/article/grumpy-cat-and-lil-bub-felines-behind-memes-and-movie-deals-100381|title=Rise of the Hollywood Cats: Inside Grumpy Cat and Lil BUB's Big Deals|website=TheWrap|date=July 12, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> As part of her Spokescat sponsorship, Friskies paid travel expenses to SXSW in [[Austin, Texas]], in order to film "Will Kitty Play With It?"<ref name="tmz">{{cite web|url=https://www.tmz.com/2013/03/08/grumpy-cat-friskies-paycheck-sxsw-film-festival/|title=Grumpy Cat – Pamprrrrd at Friskies Photo Shoot|date=March 8, 2013|publisher=TMZ|access-date=March 12, 2013}}</ref>
[[CNN]], [[CBS News]], and [[CNET]] called Grumpy Cat the undisputed "biggest star" of SXSW Interactive over [[Elon Musk]], [[Al Gore]], and [[Neil Gaiman]].<ref name="cnn" /><ref>{{cite news|last=Ngak|first=Chenda|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/8301-205_162-57573676/as-sxsw-interactive-winds-down-grumpy-cat-is-clear-winner/|title=As SXSW Interactive winds down, Grumpy cat is clear winner|date=March 11, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019|publisher=CBS News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-14013_3-57573517/if-grumpy-cat-is-the-biggest-news-of-all-is-sxsw-in-trouble/|title=If Grumpy Cat is the biggest news of all, is SXSW in trouble?|last=Terdiman|first=Daniel|date=March 11, 2013|publisher=CNET|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> Over 600 fans waited for hours in the line, which was nearly three [[City block|block]]s long, to take a photo.<ref name="abc" /><ref name="time" /><ref name="cnn" /><ref name="npr">{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/blogs/alltechconsidered/2013/03/11/173928533/the-most-talked-about-tech-and-culture-trends-at-sxsw-interactive?sc=tw&cc=share|title=The Most Talked About Tech And Culture Trends At SXSW Interactive |first1=Elise|last1=Hu|first2=Laura|last2=Sydell|date=March 11, 2013|publisher=NPR|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> Among the crowds were Internet entrepreneur [[Dennis Crowley]], singer [[Andrew W.K.]], and actor [[Ian Somerhalder]]. Somerhalder took photos with Grumpy Cat and called her his "new love", and described her as "very peaced out", "sweet as pumpkin pie", and "kind of amazing".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://people.com/pets/ian-somerhalder-falls-in-love-with-grumpy-cat-at-sxsw/|title=Ian Somerhalder Falls in Love with Grumpy Cat at SXSW|last=Schwartz|first=Alison|date=March 11, 2013|work=People|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2013/03/12/vampire-diaries-star-falls-for-a-certain-grumpy-cat/|title='Vampire Diaries' star falls for a certain grumpy cat|date=March 12, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019|publisher=CNN}}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet|first=Ian|last=Somerhalder|user=iansomerhalder|number=310869650122629120|title=Me and my new love... http://instagr.am/p/WsVAndKJ6Z/|date=March 10, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet|user=iansomerhalder|number=310848520502513665|title=Oops! I left out Grumpy cat!!! This cat is kind of amazing...|first=Ian|last=Somerhalder|date=March 10, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Malkin|first=Marc |url=http://www.eonline.com/news/396357/ian-somerhalder-s-new-love-she-is-a-sweetie-pie-with-beautiful-eyes|title=Ian Somerhalder's New Love: "She Is a Sweetie Pie With Beautiful Eyes"|website=E! Online|date=March 11, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
=== 2014 === * Television commercial for [[Honey Nut Cheerios]].<ref>{{cite web|publisher=The Random Cat Lover's|title=When grumpy cat meets honey nut cherrios bee|date=April 20, 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-XQnSCu-Sks|via=YouTube|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *Season finale appearance on ABC Network's, ''[[The Bachelorette (American TV series)|The Bachelorette]]''.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/33584-grumpy-cat-guest-stars-on-bachelorette-finale-totally-upstages-josh-murrays-proposal|title=Grumpy Cat Guest Stars on 'Bachelorette' Finale & Totally Upstages Josh Murray's Proposal|last=Sorren|first=Martha|work=Bustle|date=July 29, 2014|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *Featured as a [[List of WWE Raw guest stars|special guest]] on the November 17, 2014, edition of [[WWE]] ''[[WWE Raw|Monday Night Raw]]''.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fowler|first=Tara|url=https://people.com/pets/grumpy-cat-to-host-wwes-monday-night-raw/|title=Grumpy Cat to Host WWE's Monday Night Raw|work=People|date=November 10, 2014|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *
=== 2016 === * Special appearance on [[Disney Channel]]'s ''[[Bizaardvark]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://video.disney.com/watch/disneychannel-grumpy-cat-pitch-53e0a05b1785e5e6c6e53f1d|title=Grumpy Cat Pitch|publisher=Disney|date=October 2, 2016|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
==Friskies sponsorship== Grumpy Cat appeared in episodes of the [[Friskies]] [[YouTube]] [[game show]] "Will Kitty Play With It?"<ref name="abc"/><ref name="tmz"/><ref>{{cite web|first=Helen A.S. |last=Popkin |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/technology/technolog/sex-death-grumpy-cat-true-meaning-sxsw-1C8773768 |title=Sex, death and Grumpy Cat: The true meaning of SXSW |publisher=NBC News |date=March 8, 2013 |access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_9zRCnidn5M|title=Grumpy Cat on Friskies® Cat Game Show, "Will Kitty Play With It?"|date=March 23, 2013|publisher=tunerzkan|via=YouTube|access-date=August 2, 2018}}</ref> In September 2013, it was announced that Grumpy Cat would become the Official Spokescat of Friskies.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://money.cnn.com/2013/09/18/news/companies/grumpy-cat-friskies/|title=Grumpy Cat signs endorsement deal with Friskies|publisher=CNN|date=September 18, 2013|first=Aaron|last=Smith|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> [[TMZ]] reported that for Grumpy Cat's SXSW Interactive appearance in Austin, Texas, Friskies paid for [[First class (aviation)|first-class]] flights, a private hotel room with [[Bed size|king-sized bed]], a personal assistant, a [[chauffeur]], and unlimited Friskies food and bottled water.<ref name="tmz"/> On March 22, 2013, Grumpy Cat traveled to New York City promoting the show and appeared on ''[[Good Morning America]]''<ref name="gma">{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/video/grumpy-cat-interview-2013-gma-meme-star-exclusive-18789027 |title=Grumpy Cat Interview 2013 on 'GMA': Meme Star Exclusive Video|publisher=ABC News |date=March 22, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> and ''[[Anderson Live]]'',<ref name="andersonlive">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=toYQ2ery1Bg |title=Grumpy Cat in the House! |work=Anderson Live|via=YouTube |date=March 22, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> and visited ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' for a [[photo shoot]].<ref name="time">{{cite magazine|last1=Waxman|first1=Olivia B.|last2=Carbone|first2=Nick|url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/03/22/grumpy-cat-is-not-impressed-by-times-photoshoot/ |title=Internet Celebrity Grumpy Cat Is Not Impressed by TIME's Photo Shoot |magazine=Time |date=March 22, 2013 |access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
== Merchandising == Grumpy Cat Limited held eight trademarks in August 2018 registered with the [[United States Patent and Trademark Office]]; 1082 items were available on the official Grumpy Cat online shop.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://trademarks.justia.com/owners/grumpy-cat-limited-2594631/|title=Grumpy Cat Limited Trademarks|website=trademarks.justia.com|publisher=Justia Inc|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref>
=== Licensed merchandise === Licensed merchandise like T-shirts and [[mug]]s are advertised on the Grumpy Cat website and sold at [[Hot Topic]].<ref name="austinchronicle">{{cite web|last=Brenner|first=Wayne Alan|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/blogs/sxsw/2013-03-08/yes-you-could-totally-meet-grumpy-cat-at-sxsw/|title=Yes, You Could Totally Meet Grumpy Cat at SXSW: And here's an interview with the people behind the varmint|work=The Austin Chronicle|date=March 8, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> [[Stuffed toy]]s are also available, the original official [[Stuffed toy|plush]] was produced by [[Gund]], though as of August 2018, no Grumpy Cat merchandise was available on the Gund website.<ref name="gund">{{cite web|url=https://www.gund.com/category/characters/grumpy+cat.do|title=Grumpy Cat - CHARACTERS|website=gund.com| publisher=Enesco, LLC|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151119173708/https://www.gund.com/category/characters/grumpy+cat.do|archive-date=November 19, 2015|access-date=August 2, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://gund.com/search?type=product&q=grumpy+cat|title=grumpy cat|website=gund.com|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref> [[Ganz (toy company)|Ganz]], the company behind [[Webkinz]], produced a small Grumpy Cat plush which allowed anyone to play with her electronic likeness on the Webkinz website.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.ganz.com/pressrelease_grumpy_cat_will_meet_new_namesake_webkinz_on_opening_day_of_toy_fair.php|title=GRUMPY CAT™ will meet new namesake Webkinz™ on opening day of Toy Fair|publisher=Ganz|date=February 6, 2014|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
Additionally, [[Chronicle Books]] has published The Grumpy Cat Wall Calendar each year since 2013, with a 2022 edition available as of January 2022.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Grumpy Cat 2022 Wall Calendar|url=https://www.chroniclebooks.com/products/grumpy-cat-2022-wall-calendar|access-date=2022-01-18|website=Chronicle Books|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thinkgeek.com/product/11ac/|title=Grumpy Cat 2014 Wall Calendar|date=September 28, 2012|publisher=ThinkGeek|access-date=August 2, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.chroniclebooks.com/titles/grumpy-cat-2019-wall-calendar.html|title=Grumpy Cat 2019 Wall Calendar|publisher=Chronicle Books|access-date=August 5, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919122703/https://www.chroniclebooks.com/titles/grumpy-cat-2019-wall-calendar.html|archive-date=September 19, 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>
=== Books === The official Grumpy Cat book, ''Grumpy Cat: A Grumpy Book'', was published on July 23, 2013, by Chronicle Books.<ref name="wsj" /> The book is available in both print and digital formats from retailers worldwide. It debuted at #8 hardcover nonfiction on the ''[[Publishers Weekly]]'' best seller list.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/features/books/sc-ent-0801-books-best-sellers-20130802,0,6307558.story |title=Best-sellers: Best-sellers of hardcover fiction and nonfiction |work=Chicago Tribune |date= August 2, 2013|access-date=August 5, 2013}}</ref> Another Grumpy Cat book called ''The Grumpy Guide to Life: Observations by Grumpy Cat'' was published by Chronicle Books and debuted at #3 on [[The New York Times Best Seller list|''The New York Times'' Best Seller list]] in the Advice, How-To and Miscellaneous category.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2014-08-24/advice-how-to-and-miscellaneous/list.html|title=The New York Times Best Seller List|work=The New York Times|date=August 24, 2014|first=Parul|last=Sehgal|author-link=Parul Sehgal|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
[[Dynamite Entertainment]] publishes a comic book about Grumpy Cat and her brother, titled ''The Misadventures of Grumpy Cat and Pokey''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/comic-previews/the-misadventures-of-grumpy-cat-and-pokey-1-dynamite-entertainment-2015|title=The Misadventures of Grumpy Cat and Pokey #1|website=Comic Book Resources|date=October 5, 2015|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/search2.html?0=19&next0=&KMPZ=grumpy+cat|title=Search: grumpy cat|website=dynamite.com|publisher=Dynamite Entertainment|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
[[Dover Publications]] has also published Grumpy Cat [[paper doll]], sticker, coloring, and tattoo books.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://doverpublications.ecomm-search.com/search?keywords=Grumpy%20Cat| title=Search: Grumpy Cat |website=doverpublications.com |access-date= April 11, 2015}}</ref>
=== Digital products === In December 2013, an official video game called ''Grumpy Cat: Unimpressed'' was released by Ganz Studios and is playable on [[Facebook]], [[iOS]] devices and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] devices. The game is a [[Tile-matching video game|match-three game]] where if combos are performed, Grumpy Cat's insults will appear. The players unlock her memes as they pass each level and she can be made angry with meows, hairballs and laser pointers.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.giantbomb.com/grumpy-cat-unimpressed/3030-44810/|title=Grumpy Cat: Unimpressed|date=December 19, 2013|website=Giant Bomb|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
== Legal issues == === ''Grumpy Cat Limited v. Grenade Beverage LLC'' === In May 2013, Grumpy Cat Limited partnered with Grenade Beverage LLC to market "Grumppuccino" iced coffee beverages.<ref name="wsj" /><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/leisure/2013/07/31/grumpy-cat-expands-empire-with-iced-coffee-called-grumppuccino/|title=Grumpy Cat expands empire with iced coffee called Grumppuccino|date=July 31, 2013|access-date=August 5, 2013|publisher=Fox News}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/07/30/grumpy-cat-grumpuccino-is-sure-to-make-you-not-smile/|title=Grumpy Cat Grumpuccino Is Sure to Make You (Not) Smile|last=Locker|first=Melissa|date=July 30, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019|magazine=Time}}</ref>
In December 2015, Grumpy Cat Limited filed a lawsuit against Grenade Beverage LLC citing [[trademark infringement]] when the beverage company expanded its line of Grumpy Cat coffee offerings beyond what was originally agreed upon, producing and marketing a Grumpy Cat roasted ground coffee even after being told by email that they were not approved to do so.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://apps.washingtonpost.com/g/documents/national/grumpy-cat-complaint/2720/|title=Grumpy Cat Complaint|newspaper=The Washington Post|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref>
In January 2018, the [[United States District Court for the Central District of California|U.S. District Court for the Central District of California]] jury sided with Grumpy Cat Limited and ordered Grenade Beverage Company to pay $710,000 in damages for copyright and trademark infringement, as well as a $1 nominal damage fee for breach of contract.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42808521|title=Grumpy Cat wins $710,000 payout in copyright lawsuit|date=January 24, 2018|access-date=May 22, 2019|work=BBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://apps.washingtonpost.com/g/documents/national/grumpy-cat-verdict/2719/|title=Grumpy Cat Verdict|newspaper=The Washington Post|access-date=August 4, 2018}}</ref>
== Death == Tardar Sauce died at her home in the arms of her owner Tabatha following complications from a [[urinary tract infection]] on May 14, 2019, at age 7.<ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/grumpy-cat-dead_n_5cde79b2e4b00e035b8daba1|title=Grumpy Cat, Online Pet Sensation, Dead At 7|work=[[HuffPost]]|date=May 17, 2019|access-date=May 22, 2019|first=Lee|last=Moran|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190517100542/https://www.huffpost.com/entry/grumpy-cat-dead_n_5cde79b2e4b00e035b8daba1|archive-date=May 17, 2019|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|archive-date=May 17, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190517103751/https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/17/business/media/grumpy-cat-dead.html|title=Grumpy Cat, Whose Frown Inspired an Internet Meme, Is Dead at 7|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=May 17, 2019|access-date=May 22, 2019|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/17/business/media/grumpy-cat-dead.html|first=Daniel|last=Victor|url-status=live}}</ref> Her death was announced on May 17, 2019, on [[social media]] and she was mourned by many people across the globe. Tributes were posted worldwide.<ref name=":0" /> She was buried at Sunland Pet Rest Cemetery in Sun City, Arizona.
== Film == Grumpy Cat appears in ''[[Lil Bub & Friendz]]'', a documentary premiered at the [[Tribeca Film Festival]] on April 18, 2013, and won the Tribeca Online Festival Best Feature Film.<ref name="austinchronicle"/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/03/18/lil-bub-and-friendz-trailer-video_n_2900853.html?ncid=edlinkusaolp00000003|title='Lil Bub & Friendz' Trailer: From Meme To The Movies (VIDEO)|last=Makarechi|first=Kia|date=March 18, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019|work=HuffPost}}</ref><ref name="tribecafilm">{{cite web|url=http://www.tribecafilm.com/filmguide/5132382f1c7d76a6bb0001f8-lil-bub-friendz|title=Lil Bub & Friendz|publisher=Tribeca Film Festival|access-date=August 2, 2018}}</ref><ref name="tff-winners">{{cite web|url=http://tribecafilm.com/festival/features/tff-2013-award-winners|title=Here Are Your TFF 2013 Award Winners|date=April 25, 2013|publisher=Tribeca Film Festival|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> In May 2013, Broken Road Productions [[Option (filmmaking)|option]]ed Grumpy Cat for a "''[[Garfield]]''-like feature film" adaptation.<ref name="wsj"/><ref name="deadline">{{cite web|url=https://www.deadline.com/2013/05/if-this-doesnt-make-her-smile-nothing-will-grumpy-cat-gets-movie-deal/|title=Grumpy Cat Gets Garfield-Like Movie Deal|last=Fleming|first=Mike Jr|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=May 29, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/blogs/movietalk/fans-want-grumpy-cat-movie-171228850.html|title=What Fans Want From Grumpy Cat, the Movie|last=Deming|first=Mark|date=May 30, 2013|publisher=[[Yahoo! Movies]]|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> Film producer [[Todd Garner]] said, "We think we can build a big family comedy around this character".<ref name="deadline"/>
On June 11, 2014, it was announced that [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]] would produce a film starring Grumpy Cat, entitled ''[[Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever]]''. The film debuted on November 29, 2014. [[Tim Hill (director)|Tim Hill]], the film's director, and Jeff Morris wrote the script, and principal photography took place over the summer.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/grumpy-cat-star-lifetime-holiday-710768|title=Grumpy Cat to Star in Lifetime Holiday Movie (Exclusive)|last=Jarvey|first=Natalie|date=June 11, 2014|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> [[Aubrey Plaza]] voiced the Grumpy Cat character,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/lifetimes-grumpy-cat-aubrey-plaza-725727|title=Lifetime Chooses Voice of Grumpy Cat|last=Goldberg|first=Lesley|date=September 17, 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> and was also a producer on the film. On November 6, 2014, Lifetime released a tongue-in-cheek video about the casting and Plaza's "process" for becoming the voice of Grumpy Cat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://screenertv.com/news-features/aubrey-plaza-grumpy-cat-movie-audition-video/|title=Watch Aubrey Plaza nail the Grumpy Cat audition video|author=Huggins|first=Sarah|date=November 6, 2014|website=screenertv.com|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
The film received mostly negative reviews.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Viruet|first1=Pilot|title='Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever' Is Every Bit as Awful as You Feared|url=http://flavorwire.com/490576/grumpy-cats-worst-christmas-ever-is-every-bit-as-awful-as-you-feared|publisher=Flavorwire|access-date=November 30, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Stuever|first1=Hank|title=Grumpy Cat's Lifetime holiday movie: Claws out for Claus|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/tv/grumpy-cats-lifetime-holiday-movie-claws-out-for-claus/2014/11/28/59792c8c-7717-11e4-bd1b-03009bd3e984_story.html|newspaper=[[Washington Post]]|access-date=November 30, 2014|date=November 28, 2014}}</ref> On [[review aggregator]] [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film holds an approval rating of 27%, based on 11 reviews, and an average rating of 4.17/10.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/grumpy_cats_worst_christmas_ever_2014/ | title=''Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever'' |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] }}</ref>
== Earnings == In March 2013, Bryan Bundesen indicated that Grumpy Cat earned them income in the "mid-five figures", which increased to "low-six-figures" by May 2013.<ref name="cnn" /><ref name="wsj" /> As of August 2018, the Bundesens had not disclosed the Grumpy Cat brand's net worth, though online speculation estimated it between $1 million and $100 million.<ref name="nymag">{{cite web|url=https://nymag.com/news/business/boom-brands/grumpy-cat-ben-lashes-2013-10/index.html|title=Boom Brands 2013: Grumpy Cat|last=Van Syckle|first=Katie|date=September 29, 2013|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/weird/544409/Grumpy-Cat-worth-more-than-Hollywood-stars|title=Cheer up Grumpy Cat, you've got a £64million fortune|last=Parker|first=Mike|date=December 7, 2014|work=Daily Express|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
== Recognition == *[[MSNBC]] named Grumpy Cat 2012's most influential cat.<ref name="deadline"/> *Grumpy Cat is one of a few select non-humans to receive one of ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]''{{'}}s signature [[Stippling|stipple]] portraits.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://gawker.com/grumpy-cat-latest-non-human-entity-to-get-wsj-stipple-p-510568066|title=Grumpy Cat Latest Non-Human Entity To Get WSJ Stipple Portrait|last=Layne|first=Ken|work=Gawker|date=May 30, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *Grumpy Cat won [[BuzzFeed]]'s Meme of the Year Award at the [[2013 Webby Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://chicagotribune.newspapers.com/clip/40163393/chicago_tribune/|title=Celebrities|newspaper=Chicago Tribune|location=Chicago, Illinois|date=May 31, 2013|page=4-2|via=Newspapers.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MxJ2pPKc414 |title=Patton Oswalt Presents Meme of the Year |publisher=The Webby Awards|via=YouTube |date=May 22, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *Grumpy Cat won first prize Golden Kitty at the second annual [[Internet Cat Video Festival]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Brooks|first=Jennifer|url=http://www.startribune.com/local/221578681.html |title=Glamorous. Glowering. Grumpy Cat visits the fair |work=Star Tribune |date=August 29, 2013 |access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|last=Waxman|first=Olivia B. |url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/08/29/grumpy-cat-is-officially-the-internets-favorite-feline-meme/ |title=Grumpy Cat Is Officially the Internet's Favorite Feline Meme |magazine=Time |date=August 29, 2013 |access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *Grumpy Cat won a Lifetime Achievement Award at the 2013 Friskies.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Waxman|first=Olivia B.|url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/10/16/1-year-old-grumpy-cat-wins-lifetime-achievement-award-for-being-a-cat/ |title=1-Year-Old Grumpy Cat Wins Lifetime Achievement Award for Being a Cat |magazine=Time |date= October 16, 2013|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref> *[[Foursquare Swarm|Swarm by Foursquare]] released a limited-edition sticker featuring Grumpy Cat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.foursquare.com/post/130226006388/everycheckinsavesakitten|title=#EveryCheckInSavesAKitten|website=The Foursquare Blog|date=September 30, 2015|access-date=May 22, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151003201621/http://blog.foursquare.com/post/130226006388/everycheckinsavesakitten|archive-date=October 3, 2015}}</ref> *Grumpy Cat won People's Voice Award in the Social Content and Marketing – Animals Category at the [[2015 Webby Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.webbyawards.com/winners/2015/social/social-content-and-marketing/animals/grumpy-cat/|title=Grumpy Cat|publisher=The Webby Awards|access-date=May 22, 2019}}</ref>
